title: 103_s1345
content: The Equity in Educational Land Grant Status Act of 1993 is cited in Section 1. Section 2 provides definitions. The term "Institute" in this Act refers to the Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development established under section 1504 of the American Indian, Alaska Native, and Native Hawaiian Culture and Arts Development Act. Tribal-controlled community colleges are defined under section 2(a)(4). Tribally controlled community colleges are defined by the Tribal Controlled Community College Assistance Act of 1978 as post-secondary vocational institutions. Tribally controlled vocational institutions are defined by the Tribal Controlled Vocational Institutions Support Act of 1990. Tribally controlled community colleges and post-secondary vocational institutions have SEC. 3 land grant status. The Institute, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, and Haskell Indian Junior College shall be considered land-grant colleges established for the benefit of agriculture and the mechanic arts in accordance with the provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. The applicability of related provisions of any Act is also mentioned. The Act of July 2, 1862, amended provisions related to land-grant colleges in the United States and its territories. Any provision of an Act of Congress assisting a land-grant college shall apply to the colleges and institutions described in the same manner and to the same extent. Authorization of provisions is also mentioned. Authorization of appropriations is granted for tribal colleges and institutions, allowing for a $10,000,000 allocation for the endowment and maintenance of colleges benefiting agriculture and mechanical arts. Authorized appropriations of $10,000,000 for tribal colleges and institutions to benefit agriculture and mechanical arts. Amounts granted under this section are considered to have been allocated subject to applicable provisions for proceeds from land sales. The Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 may be cited as such. The Act provides definitions for its implementation. The term "1994 Institutions" in the Equity in Educational Land-Grant Status Act of 1993 refers to a list of colleges including Bay Mills Community College, Blackfeet Community College, Cheyenne River Community College, D-Q University, Dullknife Memorial College, Fond Du Lac Community College, Fort Belknap Community College, Fort Berthold Community College, Fort Peck Community College, Lac Courte Orielles Ojibwa Community College, Little Big Horn Community College, Little Hoop Community College, Nebraska Indian Community College, Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, and Standing Rock College. The list of 1994 Institutions includes Northwest Indian College, Oglala Lakota College, Salish Kootenai College, Sinte Gleska University, Sisseton Wahpeton Community College, Standing Rock College, Stonechild Community College, Turtle Mountain Community College, Navajo Community College, United Tribes Technical College, Southwest Indian Polytechnic Institute, Institute of American Indian and Alaska Native Culture and Arts Development, Crownpoint Institute of Technology, Haskell Indian Junior College, Leech Lake Tribal College, and College of the Menominee Nation. SEC. 3. LAND-GRANT STATUS FOR 1994 INSTITUTIONS. 1994 Institutions are considered land-grant colleges established for agriculture and mechanic arts. They are subject to provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862, and related provisions of Acts of Congress applying to land-grant colleges in various regions, with some exceptions. In contrast to 1994 Institutions, the Act of July 2, 1862, provisions for public land donations do not apply to agricultural research Acts for eligible colleges. Authorized appropriation of $23,000,000 to 1994 Institutions for the endowment and maintenance of colleges for agriculture and mechanic arts, subject to provisions of the Act of July 2, 1862. SEC. 4. APPROPRIATIONS. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to include funding for 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide funding for 1994 Institutions, with $5,000,000 authorized annually for their purposes. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions for specific purposes. The funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process and administered by State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. The Act of August 30, 1890 is amended to provide $5,000,000 annually for 1994 Institutions. Funds will be distributed through a competitive applications process and administered by State institutions in cooperation with 1994 Institutions. Matching requirement for funds made available pursuant to subsection (b)(3) is not required. SEC. 5. RESEARCH FACILITIES. The Research Facilities Act is amended to assist 1994 Institutions in constructing, acquiring, and remodeling buildings and laboratories for research in agriculture and sciences through matching grants. Subsections are redesignated in section 4. The Research Facilities Act is amended to provide $1,700,000 annually for grants to 1994 Institutions for research facilities in agriculture and sciences. Subsections in section 4 are redesignated. The title is amended to read: "A bill to provide land-grant status for certain Indian colleges and institutions."
